channel.title: [PI] Hit twice?
channel.description: im trying to make my .. lets just say whip hit twice.. like 2 hitmarks on a npc each attack... but i cant seem to find out how to do it.. so please help me guys :D ?

item.title: [PI] Hit twice?
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:4, topic:542280”]Does your server have dragon claws added? You can attempt to duplicate how that’s done, otherwise try appending a second force hit in the first.

ie

[code=java]void doHit(Player p, int dmg) {
if (p.getWeapon() == Item.DRAGON_CLAWS && p.firstHit()) { doHit(p, 30); p.setFirstHit(false); }

// …
[/code]
Then reset your flag (first hit) elsewhere, to make sure it runs next time too.[/quote]
or look at code for Dragon dagger spec.
I think it has a variable like “hitdiff2” or something, if you look through your player update code it has a sub section in the update block. Find it there, trace it back and one of them will help you (:

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Hit twice?
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

Does your server have dragon claws added? You can attempt to duplicate how that’s done, otherwise try appending a second force hit in the first.

ie

[code=java]void doHit(Player p, int dmg) {
if (p.getWeapon() == Item.DRAGON_CLAWS && p.firstHit()) { doHit(p, 30); p.setFirstHit(false); }

// …
[/code]

Then reset your flag (first hit) elsewhere, to make sure it runs next time too.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Hit twice?
item.dc:creator: @Quintorz Quintorz
item.description:
@Quintorz wrote:

Pure_:

You will need to increase it’s attack speed, search for a delay of sorts in your server files. Probably in/around your combat classes.

Thats just gonna speed up the emote too… i want this to like hit normally but with 2 hitmarks

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Hit twice?
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

You will need to increase it’s attack speed, search for a delay of sorts in your server files. Probably in/around your combat classes.
